Shadows and Light in Cologne Cathedral (Cologne, Germany)

This stained glass window in Cologne Cathedral really surprised me; it justaposes strongly with all the other - traditional - windows. Consisting only of different coloured dots, it reminds me of pixels and makes me think of a 'technology' themed church.

This stained glass window in Cologne Cathedral really surprised me; it justaposes strongly with all the other - traditional - windows. Consisting only of different coloured dots, it reminds me of pixels and makes me think of a 'technology' themed church.
windows glass germany religious deutschland europe buildingdetail silhouettes churches cathedrals cologne stainedglass köln unesco worldheritagesite christianity canonxsi canon450dxsi runintherain

Statue of Archangel Michael with traditional shield bearing the inscription 'quis ut deus' ('Who is like God?') I love random details in churches... I really think the person that's being stood on (or killed? Going deaf? Suffering from neck pain?) looks more Mayan than Gothic.
